content:
Diagnosis:	Left breast clear cell carcinoma, T1bN0M0, diagnosed March 2024

ER/PR negative, HER2 2+ (awaiting FISH), AKT mutation positive

CT staging 15 March 2024 - no evidence of metastatic disease

Bone scan 18 March 2024 - normal

[redacted name] is a 45-year-old lady who presented with a screen-detected left breast lesion. Core biopsy on 10/3/24 confirmed clear cell carcinoma. Staging investigations show no evidence of metastatic disease.

In her past medical history, she has well-controlled asthma on regular inhalers and migraine. She takes salbutamol and beclomethasone inhalers, and sumatriptan as required.

On examination today, there is a small palpable mass in the left breast at 2 o'clock position, approximately 1.2cm in size. No skin changes or nipple retraction. No palpable axillary nodes. Normal right breast examination.

I have discussed her case at the breast MDT today. Given the unusual histology and biomarker profile, we recommend primary surgery with sentinel lymph node biopsy, followed by consideration of adjuvant systemic therapy based on final pathology and HER2 FISH result.

I have arranged pre-operative assessment for next week and she will be listed for surgery in early April. We will review her again with final pathology results to discuss adjuvant treatment options. She has been given contact details for our breast care nurse specialist.

primary_cancer.biomarker_status: ER negative, PR negative, HER2 2+ (FISH pending), AKT mutation positive

cancer_timeline.value: Core biopsy confirms clear cell carcinoma
CT staging shows no evidence of metastatic disease
Bone scan normal with no evidence of metastases

patient_facts.value: 1.2cm palpable mass in left breast at 2 o'clock position, no skin changes or nipple retraction, no palpable axillary nodes

status_updates.value: Screen-detected early stage left breast clear cell carcinoma with unusual biomarker profile. No evidence of metastatic disease.
MDT recommendation for primary surgery with sentinel lymph node biopsy
Pre-operative assessment next week, surgery planned for early April, post-operative review to discuss adjuvant treatment
